channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2024041340
item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Discovered during the outbound yesterday. Manager notified DG Nav specialist. Package is both unprocessed and leaked from one of four bottles. Came from PHOL, bound for CHND, misloaded to and caught at MPGR.

item.title: Report X-2024041047
item.description:
Report X-2024041047

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: MINNEAPOLIS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/17/2024 at approximately 1900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4264197 at the station location in Minneapolis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shpment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing one cylinder. One of the packages was discovered discharging, due to a broken valve. The shipment is being held until all pressure has been depleted and the customer will be contacted for a package pick-up.

item.title: Report X-2024040788
item.description:
Report X-2024040788

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged hazmat was discovered during van pickups. The package had received a code 4 and been brought back to the station. It does not have a code 10 or code 15 to indicate when damage was initially discovered prior to return to station. The QA admin doing van pickups placed it in a lined tote, brought it to the damage area, and placed it atop the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. DescribePack: one bottle leaked from loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats
